definition: sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away

sentences.english: I wanted mother's present to be secret, but my sister let the cat out of the bag.
sentences.chinese: 給母親的禮物我原想保密的，可是妹妹卻露了馬腳。

sentences.english: Parliamentary debate would supposedly give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 議會辯論可能會露出馬腳。

sentences.english: The thief gave himself away by spending so much money.
sentences.chinese: 這個小偷因大量花錢而露了馬腳。

sentences.english: Laura played a joke on her father and gave herself away by laughing.
sentences.chinese: 勞拉念和父親開個玩哭，可是她一哭就露了馬腳。

sentences.english: The antelope realized that, by getting so angry, the hunter had given himself away a second time.
sentences.chinese: 羚羊明白，獵人惱羞成怒，再次露出了馬腳。

sentences.english: Oh, you've finally got on the track, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，你終於露出馬腳了，歐先生。

sentences.english: He pretended to be English but his foreign accent gave him away.
sentences.chinese: 他裝成英國人，但他的外國口音使他露出了馬腳。

sentences.english: The apy gave himself away by speaking with an American accent.
sentences.chinese: 間諜由於說美國口音而露馬腳。

sentences.english: Fine clothes may disguise, but silly words will disclose a fool.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的外衣可以包裝傻瓜，但蠢話總會露出馬腳。

sentences.english: He didn't give himself away so far.
If you are traveling alone, try to hide that fact.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是單獨出行，可千萬別露出馬腳。

sentences.english: Perfectly passable inexpensive pieces are given away time and again by their crappy buttons.
sentences.chinese: 廉價的還可以讓衣服屢次被它們糟糕的扣子露出馬腳。

sentences.english: But at these prices, it is difficult to avoid a paper trail.
sentences.chinese: 但是，以這樣的價錢，很難不在個人賬面上露出馬腳。

sentences.english: He betrayed himself without meaning to.
